item.title: Advanced Characterization
item.description: I have long been fascinated by materials characterization, and in-particular the ability to image atoms and nanoscale phenomena at high spatial resolution. In many scenarios, the best way to do that is using transmission electron microscopy (TEM). In my PhD work, I have collaborated with experimentalists to directly image moir√® superlattices at the interface of 2D/3D materials and investigate phonon localization at the interface between two 2D materials with high-resolution (S)TEM-based techniques.
